docs.title: Welcome to My Math Notes
docs.text: Welcome to this collection of mathematical notes and formulas. This site serves as a quick reference guide for essential concepts in Algebra, Calculus, and Geometry.

docs.title: Project Overview
docs.text: This documentation is built using MkDocs and MathJax to render high-quality mathematical equations directly in the browser.

docs.title: Structure
docs.text:
• Algebra: Fundamental formulas for polynomials, sequences, and equations.
  • Calculus: Key rules for differentiation and integration.
  • Geometry: Essential theorems and formulas for shapes and volumes.

Select a topic from the navigation menu to begin.

docs.title: Algebra Formulas
docs.text: Here is a collection of 10 fundamental formulas used frequently in Algebra.

docs.title: 1. Quadratic Formula
docs.text:
Used to find the roots of a quadratic equation \(ax^2 + bx + c = 0\).

\[ x = \frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2 - 4ac}}{2a} \]

docs.title: 2. Slope-Intercept Form
docs.text:
The equation of a line with slope \(m\) and y-intercept \(b\).

\[ y = mx + b \]

docs.title: 3. Difference of Squares
docs.text:
A method for factoring binomials.

\[ a^2 - b^2 = (a - b)(a + b) \]

docs.title: 4. Perfect Square Trinomial
docs.text:
Expansion of a squared binomial.

\[ (a + b)^2 = a^2 + 2ab + b^2 \]

docs.title: 5. Distance Formula
docs.text:
Calculates the distance between two points \((x_1, y_1)\) and \((x_2, y_2)\).

\[ d = \sqrt{(x_2 - x_1)^2 + (y_2 - y_1)^2} \]

docs.title: 6. Midpoint Formula
docs.text:
Finds the center point between two coordinates.

\[ M = \left( \frac{x_1 + x_2}{2}, \frac{y_1 + y_2}{2} \right) \]

docs.title: 7. Logarithm Product Rule
docs.text:
Simplifies the logarithm of a product.

\[ \log_b(xy) = \log_b(x) + \log_b(y) \]

docs.title: 8. Logarithm Power Rule
docs.text:
Moves the exponent to the front of the logarithm.

\[ \log_b(x^n) = n \cdot \log_b(x) \]

docs.title: 9. Arithmetic Sequence Term
docs.text:
Finds the \(n\)-th term where \(a_1\) is the first term and \(d\) is the difference.

\[ a_n = a_1 + (n - 1)d \]

docs.title: 10. Geometric Sequence Term
docs.text:
Finds the \(n\)-th term where \(r\) is the common ratio.

\[ a_n = a_1 \cdot r^{n-1} \]

docs.title: Calculus Formulas
docs.text: Key formulas for differentiation and integration.

docs.title: 1. Definition of Derivative
docs.text:
The fundamental limit definition of a derivative.

\[ f'(x) = \lim_{h \to 0} \frac{f(x+h) - f(x)}{h} \]

docs.title: 2. Power Rule
docs.text:
The basic rule for differentiating powers of \(x\).

\[ \frac{d}{dx}(x^n) = n \cdot x^{n-1} \]

docs.title: 3. Product Rule
docs.text:
Used when differentiating two functions multiplied together.

\[ \frac{d}{dx}[f(x)g(x)] = f'(x)g(x) + f(x)g'(x) \]

docs.title: 4. Quotient Rule
docs.text:
Used when differentiating one function divided by another.

\[ \frac{d}{dx}\left[\frac{f(x)}{g(x)}\right] = \frac{f'(x)g(x) - f(x)g'(x)}{[g(x)]^2} \]

docs.title: 5. Chain Rule
docs.text:
Used for differentiating composite functions.

\[ \frac{d}{dx}[f(g(x))] = f'(g(x)) \cdot g'(x) \]

docs.title: 6. Fundamental Theorem of Calculus
docs.text:
Relates differentiation and integration.

\[ \int_{a}^{b} f(x) \, dx = F(b) - F(a) \]

docs.title: 7. Integration by Parts
docs.text:
The product rule in reverse for integration.

\[ \int u \, dv = uv - \int v \, du \]

docs.title: 8. L'Hôpital's Rule
docs.text:
Used to evaluate limits that result in indeterminate forms like \(0/0\).

\[ \lim_{x \to c} \frac{f(x)}{g(x)} = \lim_{x \to c} \frac{f'(x)}{g'(x)} \]

docs.title: 9. Maclaurin Series for \(e^x\)
docs.text:
Expansion of the exponential function.

\[ e^x = \sum_{n=0}^{\infty} \frac{x^n}{n!} = 1 + x + \frac{x^2}{2!} + \frac{x^3}{3!} + \dots \]

docs.title: 10. Mean Value Theorem
docs.text:
States there is a tangent parallel to the secant line.

\[ f'(c) = \frac{f(b) - f(a)}{b - a} \]

docs.title: Geometry Formulas
docs.text: Essential formulas for shapes, areas, and volumes.

docs.title: 1. Pythagorean Theorem
docs.text:
Relates the sides of a right-angled triangle.

\[ a^2 + b^2 = c^2 \]

docs.title: 2. Area of a Triangle
docs.text:
Basic area formula given base \(b\) and height \(h\).

\[ A = \frac{1}{2}bh \]

docs.title: 3. Area of a Circle
docs.text:
Area given the radius \(r\).

\[ A = \pi r^2 \]

docs.title: 4. Circumference of a Circle
docs.text:
The distance around the circle.

\[ C = 2\pi r \]

docs.title: 5. Volume of a Sphere
docs.text:
Volume of a 3D ball.

\[ V = \frac{4}{3}\pi r^3 \]

docs.title: 6. Surface Area of a Sphere
docs.text:
The outer area of a 3D ball.

\[ A = 4\pi r^2 \]

docs.title: 7. Volume of a Cylinder
docs.text:
Volume given radius \(r\) and height \(h\).

\[ V = \pi r^2 h \]

docs.title: 8. Law of Sines
docs.text:
Relates sides and angles in any triangle.

\[ \frac{a}{\sin A} = \frac{b}{\sin B} = \frac{c}{\sin C} \]

docs.title: 9. Law of Cosines
docs.text:
Generalization of the Pythagorean theorem for any triangle.

\[ c^2 = a^2 + b^2 - 2ab \cos(C) \]

docs.title: 10. Sum of Interior Angles
docs.text:
For a polygon with \(n\) sides.

\[ S = (n - 2) \cdot 180^{\circ} \]
